summary: The document is a confidential military investigation report focusing on Joseph Timothy White, a former cadet at Kemper Military School & College (KMSC) who defected to North Korea. It explores White's personality traits, such as his intense idealism and aloofness, his struggles with peers and authority at KMSC, and his subsequent decision to leave the school and enlist in the Army with aspirations to become a non-commissioned officer (NCO). The report also touches on how his defection was perceived in light of his personality and socio-political views, concluding with recommendations against his commissioning due to perceived immaturity.
key_findings: Joseph Timothy White was characterized by his seriousness, intense idealism, and tendency to distance himself from peers.
He encountered significant personal and academic difficulties at KMSC, including ostracization by peers, disciplinary problems, and nearly failing at ROTC Advanced Camp.
Despite these challenges, White was determined to succeed but was profoundly impacted by his experiences, leading him to leave KMSC and join the Army.
His defection to North Korea was viewed by some as aligning with his personality and socio-political beliefs.
The report advises against commissioning White, citing his immaturity, and provides contacts for additional information.
